snippet: A document obtained by Edward J. Snowden shows that Australia consulted with the N.S.A. about monitoring an American law firm that was representing Indonesia in trade disputes with the United States.
abstract: Top-secret document obtained by Edward J Snowden shows that an American law firm representing Indonesian government in trade disputes with United States was monitored by Australia, which offered to share information with National Security Agency; disclosure is of interest because US lawyers with clients overseas have expressed concern that their confidential communications could be compromised by such surveillance.

byline.original: By JAMES RISEN and LAURA POITRAS
byline.contributor: James Risen reported from Washington, and Laura Poitras from Berlin. Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A document obtained by Edward J. Snowden shows that Australia consulted with the N.S.A. about monitoring an American law firm that was representing Indonesia in trade disputes with the United States.

headline.main: Spying by N.S.A. Ally Entangled U.S. Law Firm
headline.print_headline: Spying by N.S.A. Ally Entangled U.S. Law Firm

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
